content.question: Which of the following best explains the main cause of the Great Depression of the 1930s?

choices.label: The corruption of the Gilded Age prompted calls for civil service reforms.
The decline of immigration in the 1920s reduced the supply of affordable labor.
Episodes of credit and market instability undermined the financial system.
Participation in the First World War overextended the nationâ€™s financial resources.

content.answer: Episodes of credit and market instability undermined the financial system.

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
